title: Eliminates the maximum age for appointment as a member of the state police and requires retirement at age 70
summary: Eliminates the maximum age of 29 years for appointment as a member of the New York state police and requires retirement at age 70.

       AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to the qualifications for
         members of the division of state police

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision  3  of  section  215 of the executive law, as
    2  amended by chapter 478 of the laws  of  2004,  is  amended  to  read  as
    3  follows:
    4    3.  The  sworn members of the New York state police shall be appointed
    5  by the superintendent and permanent appointees may  be  removed  by  the
    6  superintendent only after a hearing. No person shall be appointed to the
    7  New  York state police force as a sworn member unless he or she shall be
    8  a citizen of the United States, [between the ages of] AT  LEAST  twenty-
    9  one  [and  twenty-nine]  years  [except  that  in  the  superintendent's
   10  discretion, the maximum age may be extended  to  thirty-five  years]  OF
   11  AGE.  [Notwithstanding  any  other  provision  of  law or any general or
   12  special law to the contrary the time spent on military duty, not exceed-
   13  ing a total of six years, shall be subtracted from the age of any appli-
   14  cant who has passed his or her twenty-ninth  birthday,  solely  for  the
   15  purpose  of permitting qualification as to age and for no other purpose.
   16  Such limitations as to age however shall not apply to persons  appointed
   17  to the positions of counsel, first assistant counsel, assistant counsel,
   18  and  assistant  deputy  superintendent for employee relations nor to any
   19  person appointed to the bureau of  criminal  investigation  pursuant  to
   20  section  two  hundred  sixteen  of this article nor shall any] NO person
   21  SHALL be appointed unless he or she has fitness and good moral character
   22  and shall have passed a physical and mental examination based upon stan-
   23  dards provided by the  rules  and  regulations  of  the  superintendent.
   24  Appointments  shall be made for a probationary period which, in the case

    1  of appointees required to attend and complete a basic  training  program
    2  at the state police academy, shall include such time spent attending the
    3  basic school and terminate one year after successful completion thereof.
    4  All other sworn members shall be subject to a probationary period of one
    5  year  from the date of appointment. Following satisfactory completion of
    6  the probationary period the  member  shall  be  a  permanent  appointee.
    7  Voluntary  resignation  or  withdrawal  from  the  New York state police
    8  during such appointment shall be submitted  to  the  superintendent  for
    9  approval.    Reasonable time shall be required to account for all equip-
   10  ment issued or for debts or obligations to the state  to  be  satisfied.
   11  Resignation  or withdrawal from the division during a time of emergency,
   12  so declared by the governor, shall not be approved if  contrary  to  the
   13  best  interest  of the state and shall be a misdemeanor. No sworn member
   14  removed from the New York state police shall be eligible for  reappoint-
   15  ment.  The  superintendent  shall  make rules and regulations subject to
   16  approval by the governor for the discipline and control of the New  York
   17  state  police  and  for the examination and qualifications of applicants
   18  for appointment as members thereto and such examinations shall  be  held
   19  and  conducted  by  the  superintendent  subject to such rules and regu-
   20  lations. The superintendent is authorized to  charge  a  fee  of  twenty
   21  dollars  as an application fee for any person applying to take a compet-
   22  itive examination for the position of trooper, and a fee of five dollars
   23  for any competitive examination for a civilian position. The superinten-
   24  dent shall promulgate regulations subject to the approval of the  direc-
   25  tor  of  the budget, to provide for a waiver of the application fee when
   26  the fee would cause an unreasonable hardship on  the  applicant  and  to
   27  establish  a  fee  schedule  and charge fees for the use of state police
   28  facilities. THE SUPERINTENDENT  SHALL  REQUIRE  THE  RETIREMENT  OF  ANY
   29  MEMBER  OF  THE  NEW YORK STATE POLICE WHO HAS ATTAINED SEVENTY YEARS OF
   30  AGE.
   31    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
